    • Constructor Detail

      • AddOnWrapper

        public AddOnWrapper(AddOn addOn,
            AddOnWrapper.Status status)

      • AddOnWrapper

        public AddOnWrapper(AddOn addOn,
            AddOnWrapper.Status status,
            String runningIssues)
        Creates an AddOnWrapper with the given addOn, status and runningIssues.
        Parameters:
        addOn - the add-on
        status - the status of the add-on
        runningIssues - a String containing the issues that prevents the add-on from being run, in HTML format
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if runningIssues is null.
        Since:
        2.4.0

    • Method Detail

      • getInstallationStatus

        public AddOn.InstallationStatus getInstallationStatus()
        Gets the installation status of the wrapper.
        Returns:
        the installation status of the wrapper.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        setInstallationStatus(org.zaproxy.zap.control.AddOn.InstallationStatus)

      • setInstallationStatus

        public void setInstallationStatus(AddOn.InstallationStatus installationStatus)
        Sets the installation status of the wrapper.

        The status might not be the same as the wrapped add-on, when the add-on is being, for example, downloaded and then installed. This allows to properly report the state of the add-on until a final status was achieved.

        Parameters:
        installationStatus - the new installation status
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getInstallationStatus()

      • setAddOnUpdate

        public void setAddOnUpdate(AddOn addOnUpdate)
        Sets the newer version of the wrapped add-on.

        The status is updated to newVersion.

        Parameters:
        addOnUpdate - the newer version or null if none
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getAddOnUpdate()

      • getAddOnUpdate

        public AddOn getAddOnUpdate()
        Gets newer version of the wrapped add-on. Might be null if none.
        Returns:
        the newer version or null if none
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        setAddOnUpdate(AddOn)

      • isAddOnRunningIssues

        public boolean isAddOnRunningIssues()
        Tells whether or not the running issues are caused by the add-on.
        Returns:
        true if the running issues are caused by the add-on, false if caused by its extensions.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        hasRunningIssues()

      • hasRunningIssues

        public boolean hasRunningIssues()
        Tells whether or not the wrapped add-on or its extensions have issues that prevent them from being run.
        Returns:
        true if the add-on or its extensions have issues that prevent them from being run, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        isAddOnRunningIssues(), getRunningIssues()

      • getRunningIssues

        public String getRunningIssues()
        Gets the issues that the wrapped add-on or its extensions might have that prevent them from being run. Might be empty if there's no issues.

        The contents are in HTML.

        Returns:
        the issues of the add-on or its extensions that prevent them from being run, empty if there's no issues.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        hasRunningIssues()

      • setRunningIssues

        public void setRunningIssues(String runningIssues,
                    boolean addOnIssues)
        Sets the issues that the wrapped add-on or its extensions might have that prevent them from being run.

        The contents should be in HTML.

        Parameters:
        runningIssues - the running issues of the add-on or its extensions, empty if there's no issues.
        addOnIssues - true if the issues are caused by the add-on, false if are caused by the extensions
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getRunningIssues()

      • isAddOnUpdateIssues

        public boolean isAddOnUpdateIssues()
        Tells whether or not the running issues, after updating, are caused by the add-on.
        Returns:
        true if the running issues, after updating, are caused by the add-on, false if caused by its extensions.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        hasUpdateIssues()

      • hasUpdateIssues

        public boolean hasUpdateIssues()
        Tells whether or not the wrapped add-on or its extensions have issues that prevents them from being run after updating.
        Returns:
        true if the add-on or its extensions have issues that prevents them from being run after updating, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        isAddOnUpdateIssues(), getUpdateIssues()

      • getUpdateIssues

        public String getUpdateIssues()
        Gets the issues that the wrapped add-on or its extensions might have that prevent them from being run after updating. Might be empty if there's no issues.

        The contents are in HTML.

        Returns:
        the issues of the add-on or its extensions that prevent them from being run after updating, empty if there's no issues.
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        hasUpdateIssues()

      • setUpdateIssues

        public void setUpdateIssues(String updateIssues,
                   boolean addOnIssues)
        Sets the issues that the newer version of the wrapped add-on or its extensions might have that prevents them from being run.

        The contents should be in HTML.

        Parameters:
        updateIssues - the running issues of the add-on or its extensions, empty if there's no issues.
        addOnIssues - true if the issues are caused by the add-on, false if are caused by the extensions
        Since:
        2.4.0
        See Also:
        getUpdateIssues()
